byline.contributor: Elian Peltier contributed reporting from Paris, and Peter Baker from Washington.

abstract: French Pres Francois Hollande, on globe-crossing tour aimed at forging alliance against Islamic State, travels to Washington to secure America's help; unpopular politician looks to assert himself on world stage ahead of 2017 elections; commentators question authenticity of his hawkish shift from Socialist roots in wake of Paris terrorist attacks.
lead_paragraph: President François Hollande of France must show that he is a wartime leader able to influence policy toward Syria and take an important role in the re-energized battle with Islamic State.

headline.main: Washington Is Next on François Hollande’s Tour to Press Allies for Anti-ISIS Coalition
headline.print_headline: Washington Is Next on Hollande Tour to Press Allies for Anti-ISIS Coalition

snippet: President François Hollande of France must show that he is a wartime leader able to influence policy toward Syria and take an important role in the re-energized battle with Islamic State.
